plan_overview: This learning plan focuses on understanding CPU performance and its comparison with GPUs in various computational contexts. Starting with evaluating CPU and GPU performance portability using SYCL, you will then explore detailed CPU vs GPU performance in a CFD-DEM solver, and finally examine CPU and GPU differences in reinforcement learning environments. This progression builds foundational knowledge of CPU architectures and performance characteristics, followed by applied comparisons and optimizations in real-world applications.

reading_order.why_first: This paper introduces SYCL performance portability across CPUs and GPUs, providing foundational knowledge on CPU architectures and programming models relevant to CPUs.
key_questions: What are the main challenges in achieving performance portability on CPUs?
How do DPC++ and OpenSYCL differ in CPU support?
What are the performance characteristics of modern CPUs like Intel Xeon, AMD EPYC, and Ampere Altra?
How do bandwidth-bound applications behave on CPUs compared to GPUs?
reading_order.paper_title:
Evaluating the performance portability of SYCL across CPUs and GPUs on
  bandwidth-bound applications

reading_order.why_first: Building on the foundational knowledge, this paper provides a direct performance comparison of a CFD-DEM solver on CPUs and GPUs, illustrating practical CPU performance in scientific computing.
key_questions: How does MFiX-Exa leverage CPU and GPU parallelism?
What are the performance differences between single CPU cores and GPUs?
How does scaling on multiple CPUs compare to multiple GPUs?
What role does adaptive time stepping play in performance on CPUs?
reading_order.paper_title: Performance comparison of CFD-DEM solver MFiX-Exa, on GPUs and CPUs

reading_order.why_first: This paper extends understanding by exploring CPU vs GPU performance in reinforcement learning through GPU-accelerated Atari emulation, highlighting CPU limitations and GPU advantages in high-throughput environments.
key_questions: What are the limitations of CPU-based emulators in reinforcement learning?
How does CuLE leverage GPU parallelization?
What performance gains are achieved by running thousands of games simultaneously on GPUs?
How does CPU-GPU communication bandwidth affect performance?
reading_order.paper_title: Accelerating Reinforcement Learning through GPU Atari Emulation

actions.label: Set up SYCL environment and run benchmarks
actions.how_to: Install DPC++ and OpenSYCL compilers, obtain benchmark codes from the paper, and run them on available CPU hardware to observe performance characteristics.
actions.expected_outcome: You will gain hands-on experience with SYCL on CPUs and understand performance portability challenges.

actions.label: Implement and profile MFiX-Exa solver on CPU
actions.how_to: Download MFiX-Exa solver, configure it to run on CPU-only mode, and profile its performance using a representative fluidized bed simulation.
actions.expected_outcome: You will measure CPU performance in a real scientific application and compare it to reported GPU results.

actions.label: Analyze CPU vs GPU performance scaling
actions.how_to: Using the MFiX-Exa solver, run scaling experiments varying CPU core counts and compare with GPU runs, focusing on parallel efficiency and speedup.
actions.expected_outcome: You will understand CPU scaling behavior and its limitations compared to GPUs.

actions.label: Explore reinforcement learning emulation on CPU and GPU
actions.how_to: Set up the CuLE environment and run Atari emulation benchmarks on CPU and GPU, measuring frame generation rates and training throughput.
actions.expected_outcome: You will observe the performance bottlenecks of CPU emulation and the advantages of GPU acceleration in reinforcement learning.

actions.label: Summarize CPU performance characteristics across applications
actions.how_to: Compile results and insights from the previous actions into a comparative report highlighting CPU strengths and weaknesses in different computational contexts.
actions.expected_outcome: You will have a clear understanding of CPU performance profiles and areas for optimization.

metrics: Speedup factor of GPU over CPU
Frames per hour generated in Atari emulation
Scaling efficiency with increasing CPU cores

timeline_weeks.focus: Understand SYCL and CPU performance portability
timeline_weeks.deliverable: Run SYCL benchmarks on CPU and document performance results.

timeline_weeks.focus: Run and profile MFiX-Exa solver on CPU
timeline_weeks.deliverable: Obtain CPU performance data for fluidized bed simulations.

timeline_weeks.focus: Perform CPU scaling experiments and compare with GPU
timeline_weeks.deliverable: Report on parallel efficiency and speedup on CPUs vs GPUs.

timeline_weeks.focus: Set up and benchmark CuLE Atari emulation on CPU and GPU
timeline_weeks.deliverable: Measure and analyze frame generation rates and throughput.

timeline_weeks.focus: Synthesize findings and prepare comparative performance report
timeline_weeks.deliverable: Comprehensive report on CPU performance across studied applications.

risks.risk: Limited access to diverse CPU hardware may restrict performance evaluation breadth.
risks.mitigation: Focus experiments on available CPU platforms and clearly state hardware limitations in analysis.

risks.risk: Complexity of setting up SYCL and CuLE environments may delay progress.
risks.mitigation: Allocate initial time for environment setup and use community resources or tutorials to assist.

_topics_suggestion: The selected papers may also cover research areas including: Applied Machine Learning, General Algorithms. You may gain a broader understand of the field by exploring these related research directions
